title: EPISTOLA N. Hamment
html:
EPISTOLA N. Hamment

I was very pleased to read Mat Coward's exposure of the grotesque mis-use of the word self and to learn that I was not alone in my hatred of it. (XXVIII/2) I cannot improve on his theory that it may originate from the old-fashioned commercial “business English,” or fomality, or perhaps in my view, a bogus attempt at gentility.

To conclude with another horribile dictu: true fact.

[N. Hamment, Bolton, Lancashire]
